page.title: 05GEOGRAPHY
page.content: The Vale of Pewsey is in south central England in a four-mile wide,flat bottomed valley running east to west. The vale is open to wet, south-westerly winds from the Atlantic in Winter, but they are dry and warm in the summer. The surrounding hills are grazed by sheep and cattle. The land in the valley bottom is mostly corn, grass or potatoes. The Downs are chalk with steep hillsides and flat tops. Below the chalk lies a thin layer of greensand which projects across most of the vale. A typical farm is about 400 acres but the biggest landowner has around 2000 acres used for wheat, barley and beef.
